mmRebarSolidAndVisible.Description: Change the state of the visibility of the rebar (view unobscured and view as solid)
mmRebarSolidAndVisible.FullDescription: The visibility state of "View unobscured" is set to any view, whether 2D or 3D. View as solid – set only in 3D view
mmRebarSolidAndVisible.Description1: Disable the state of the visibility of the rebar (view unobscured and view as solid)
mmRebarSolidAndVisible.Description2: Settings options for the selection of elements containing reinforcement for plugins
mmRebarSolidAndVisible.msg1: Select an element with rebar or reinforcement
mmRebarSolidAndVisible.msg2: Select an elements with rebar or reinforcement
mmRebarSolidAndVisible.h11: All but selected elements on view

mprWallsReinforcement.Description: Analysis, grouping and reinforcement according to given conditions of walls and openings
mprWallsReinforcement.FullDescription: Plugin works only with walls located in one level. Plugin analyzes the walls, allowing you to find three types of intersections (corner, end and cross) and openings. Flexible grouping allows you to specify exactly what type of reinforcement should be made. You can perform reinforcement only for the specified groups – walls, intersections or openings. Plugin can work even on an empty template
mprWallsReinforcement.h31: You can drag a wall from the current group to other groups
mprWallsReinforcement.h40: You can drag and drop the intersections from the current group to other groups
mprWallsReinforcement.h48: Set the basic reinforcement for size groups
mprWallsReinforcement.h58: You can drag and drop openings from the current group to other groups

mprWallsReinforcement.h252: Calculate the length of the U-shaped rod end(s)
mprWallsReinforcement.h253: Apply cover from the rebar ends at the bottom of the wall
mprWallsReinforcement.et1: Both ends are set by wall length
mprWallsReinforcement.et2: One end is set by wall length, the other end is set by value
mprWallsReinforcement.et3: Both ends are set by value
mprWallsReinforcement.rr1: Remove reinforcement of the same type that is created
mprWallsReinforcement.npa2: calculate overlap length from the top of the wall
mprWallsReinforcement.jtd1: Joints of background vertical rebars are not created. Rebars are cut on the top of the wall according to the specified value of cover from the rebars ends
mprWallsReinforcement.jtd2: Created straight joints of vertical rebars. Overlap length is set from the top of the overlying slab or from the top of the wall. When the width of the overlying wall decreases, the reinforcement is bent (if slab exist)
mprWallsReinforcement.jtd3: Vertical bar releases are created by analogy with straight releases, but with different anchorage lengths
mprWallsReinforcement.jtd4: Joints of vertical rebars with anchoring in the overlying slab are created. The length of the anchorage is counted from the side face of the wall. If the bends of the rebars can not be performed in two directions, the rebars are bent in one direction in different levels of the slab
mprWallsReinforcement.jtd5: Created straight joints of vertical rebars. Overlap length is set from the top of the overlying slab or from the top of the wall
mprWallsReinforcement.jtd6: Straight joints of vertical rebars in the form of a "bottle" are created – the bends are bent to the center of intersection to the diameter of the rebar. The overlap length is set from the top of the overlying slab
mprWallsReinforcement.jtd7: Joints are created in the overlying slab in the form of separate L-shaped bars. The first anchoring length – the length of the anchoring of the rods into the slab – is counted from the side face of the wall. The second anchoring length – the length of the anchoring of the rods into the wall – is counted from the top edge of the wall. If the bends of the rebars can not be performed in two directions, the rebars are bent in one direction in different levels of the slab
mprWallsReinforcement.jtd8: Created straight joints of vertical rebars without taking into account the overlying elements
mprWallsReinforcement.jtd9: Straight joints of vertical rebars in the form of a “bottle” are created – the bends are bent to the center of the wall at a given distance or by the diameter of the rebar. The overlap length is set from the top of the overlying slab
mprWallsReinforcement.jtd10: The vertical rebars of the background reinforcement are cut along the top of the wall according to the specified value of cover from the rebars ends. Create an anchoring into the overlying slab in the form of a separate U-shaped rod
mprWallsReinforcement.m20: The list of walls contains walls whose reinforcement settings have been changed manually and differ from the settings of the reinforcement group
mprWallsReinforcement.m21: The list of intersections contains intersections whose reinforcement settings have been changed manually and differ from the reinforcement settings of the group
mprWallsReinforcement.m22: The list of openings contains openings whose reinforcement settings have been changed manually and differ from the reinforcement settings of the group

mprWallsReinforcement.t27: A brief description of the reinforcement of the wall, where:
mprWallsReinforcement.t28: V – vertical reinforcement indicating the diameter and step of the bars
mprWallsReinforcement.t29: H – horizontal reinforcement indicating the diameter, step and position of the bars
mprWallsReinforcement.t30: S – cross reinforcement (stirrups) with diameter indication
mprWallsReinforcement.t31: U – U-shaped bars at the ends with diameter indication

mprWallsReinforcement.t39: Display in the model the next opening in the list
mprWallsReinforcement.t40: Copy the reinforcement settings of the current group to all selected groups
mprWallsReinforcement.t41: Save the reinforcement settings of current group in the xml-file
mprWallsReinforcement.t42: Load the reinforcement settings from the xml-file and set it for the current group
mprWallsReinforcement.t43: Attention! The surface appearance of the reinforcement may depend on the class of reinforcement, diameter or other values that are not considered by the program. Read the normative documentation
mprWallsReinforcement.t44: α is a coefficient that takes into account the effect on the anchoring length of the stress state of concrete and reinforcement and the structural solution of the element in the anchoring zone. When anchoring rods of a periodic profile with straight ends (straight anchoring) or smooth reinforcement with hooks or loops without additional anchoring devices for stretched rods, take α = 1.0, and for compressed ones – α = 0.75. According to clause 10.3.30 of SP 63.13330, the coefficient α may be increased to 2.0
mprWallsReinforcement.t45: According to paragraph 10.3.8 of SP 63.13330.2012, the vertical bars take no more than 2t and 400 mm (t is the thickness of the wall)
mprWallsReinforcement.t46: In accordance with GOST 21.501-2018, clause 6.4.7, the length of the detail is set along the outer edge of the rebar
mprWallsReinforcement.t47: Increases the time of the reinforcement generation!
mprWallsReinforcement.t48: The details of the reinforcement of the intersection will be established with the horizontal reinforcement of the walls – by the smallest or the largest step of horizontal reinforcement of the walls participating in the intersection
mprWallsReinforcement.t49: The number of rows of vertical reinforcement
mprWallsReinforcement.t50: The number of rows of horizontal reinforcement
mprWallsReinforcement.t51: Selecting a underlying slab directly below the selected walls. Underlying slab selection available after wall selection, analysis and grouping. You can select one or more slabs. In the properties of the underlying slabs should be included properties "Structural"
mprWallsReinforcement.t53: Reset all values ​​of the current default reinforcement settings to the default values ​​set in the plugin
mprWallsReinforcement.t54: Copy the current slab joints reinforcement settings to all selected plates
mprWallsReinforcement.t55: Save the current slab joints reinforcement settings
mprWallsReinforcement.t56: Load the joints reinforcement settings and set for the current slab
mprWallsReinforcement.t57: The minimum and maximum values ​​are calculated based on the specified diameters and vertical reinforcement step
mprWallsReinforcement.t58: Rebar length consists of two anchoring lengths
mprWallsReinforcement.t59: When you turn on the "Breaking in" option, each first pair of joints along the wall will be created with the first overlap length, every second pair – with the second overlap length
mprWallsReinforcement.t60: If the joints exceed the height of the overlying wall, they will be cut off along the upper face of the wall, taking into account the specified ends cover of the rebars
mprWallsReinforcement.t61: The selection variant applies to the selection of plates
mprWallsReinforcement.t62: The vertical rebar is moved to the place where the U-shaped rebar bend begins, which is obtained by adding the values of the cover layer of the horizontal reinforcement from the ends, the diameter of the U-shaped rebar and the standard bending diameter of the U-shaped rebar
mprWallsReinforcement.t63: You can specify preferred rebar shapes for different types of rebars created by the plugin.
mprWallsReinforcement.t64: Setting the preferred shapes does not guarantee that the reinforcement will be created using the specified shape of the rebar.
mprWallsReinforcement.t65: When creating rebars, an attempt will be made to use the specified shape. If creating a rebar with the specified shape is not possible, Revit will automatically search for a suitable shape or create a new shape.
mprWallsReinforcement.t66: Save current reinforcement settings as default reinforcement settings
mprWallsReinforcement.t67: Group walls, intersections and openings according to the current grouping settings
mprWallsReinforcement.t68: When this option is enabled, stirrups will not be created at intersections of walls and at the ends of walls where details are created (for example, U-shaped details)
mprWallsReinforcement.t69: If the horizontal bars of the background reinforcement are on the inside and the vertical bars are on the outside, it is recommended to specify the girth of the vertical bars. For the opposite case, when the horizontal bars of the background reinforcement are located outside, it is recommended to specify the girth of the horizontal bars
mprWallsReinforcement.t70: The length of the detail is taken as the length of the anchoring
mprWallsReinforcement.t71: Each second pair of rods will be indented at the bottom by a distance equal to the absolute value of the overlap length difference. The indentation does not affect the second overlap length. For example, if the first overlap length is 500 mm and the second overlap length is 750 mm, then the rods of each second pair will be indented from below 250 mm
mprWallsReinforcement.t72: Display in the model the slab selected in the list
mprWallsReinforcement.t73: Display in the model the walls that are in contact with the selected slab in the list

mprSlabsReinforcement.Description: Analysis, grouping and reinforcement of slabs for specified conditions
mprSlabsReinforcement.FullDescription: Plugin allows you to process both individually selected slabs, and all slabs in the view or in the document. The main reinforcement of the slab can be performed as separate rebars, or area reinforcement. The analysis of holes is made from the geometry of the slab itself and does not depend on the used families. Plugin can work even on an empty template
mprSlabsReinforcement.h3: Select all slabs on current view
mprSlabsReinforcement.h19: Offset of the outermost rod (along the axis of the rod) from the edge of the slab:

mprSlabsReinforcement.as2: to the middle of the slab
mprSlabsReinforcement.rr1: Remove reinforcement of the same type that is created
mprSlabsReinforcement.t1: According to SP 63.13330.2012, p. 10.3.5 – the minimum distance in the light between the rebars should be at least the largest diameter of the rod, as well as at least 25 mm for the lower reinforcement and 30 mm for the upper reinforcement; p. 10.3.8 – the largest distance between the axes of the rods should not be more than 200 mm with a plate cross-section height h <= 150 mm and no more than 1,5h and 400 mm with a cross-section height h> 150 mm
mprSlabsReinforcement.t2: Check and offset when hit on the rods of the background reinforcement is made for the first (nearest) rod, which does not guarantee the correct displacement of the second or third rod. The minimum permissible distance between the rods in the light is taken into account – 30 mm
mprSlabsReinforcement.t4: Save current reinforcement settings as default reinforcement settings
mprSlabsReinforcement.t5: If the option is enabled, then the upper and lower rebar cover will be applied when creating background reinforcement meshes, without taking into account the diameters of other reinforcement. If the option is disabled, the rebar cover will be applied for all types of reinforcement being created, and the position of the background reinforcement meshes relative to the upper and lower faces of the slab will be calculated from the established conditions
mprSlabsReinforcement.t6: U-shaped rods will be created with the rod step of the upper mesh of the background reinforcement. If the background reinforcement is not created in the slab, the U-shaped rods will be created with the specified step
mprSlabsReinforcement.t7: Check all openings in the list available for processing
mprSlabsReinforcement.t8: Uncheck all openings in the list
mprSlabsReinforcement.t9: Tied stirrups will be created with the rod step of the upper mesh of the background reinforcement. If the background reinforcement is not created in the slab, the Tied stirrups will be created with the specified step
mprSlabsReinforcement.t37: Copy the reinforcement settings of the current hole to selected holes
mprSlabsReinforcement.t38: Save the reinforcement settings of current hole
mprSlabsReinforcement.t39: Load the reinforcement settings and set it for the current hole
mprSlabsReinforcement.t40: Copy the reinforcement settings of the current slab to all selected slabs
mprSlabsReinforcement.t41: Save the reinforcement settings of current slab
mprSlabsReinforcement.t42: Load the reinforcement settings and set it for the current slab
mprSlabsReinforcement.t43: Attention! The surface appearance of the reinforcement may depend on the class of reinforcement, diameter or other values that are not considered by the program. Read the normative documentation
mprSlabsReinforcement.t44: α is a coefficient that takes into account the effect on the anchoring length of the stress state of concrete and reinforcement and the structural solution of the element in the anchoring zone. When anchoring rods of a periodic profile with straight ends (straight anchoring) or smooth reinforcement with hooks or loops without additional anchoring devices for stretched rods, take α = 1.0, and for compressed ones – α = 0.75.
mprSlabsReinforcement.t46: In accordance with GOST 21.501-2018, clause 6.4.7, the length of the detail is set along the outer edge of the rebar
mprSlabsReinforcement.t47: The length of the detail is taken as the length of the anchoring
mprSlabsReinforcement.t49: The number of rows of longitudinal direction reinforcement (in a row is two bars "along" the hole)
mprSlabsReinforcement.t50: The number of rows of transverse direction reinforcement (in a row is two bars "along" the hole)
mprSlabsReinforcement.t53: Reset all values ​​of the current default reinforcement settings to the default values ​​set in the plugin
mprSlabsReinforcement.t58: Rebar length consists of two anchoring lengths
mprSlabsReinforcement.t63: You can specify preferred rebar shapes for different types of rebars created by the plugin.
mprSlabsReinforcement.t64: Setting the preferred shapes does not guarantee that the reinforcement will be created using the specified shape of the rebar.
mprSlabsReinforcement.t65: When creating rebars, an attempt will be made to use the specified shape. If creating a rebar with the specified shape is not possible, Revit will automatically search for a suitable shape or create a new shape.
mprSlabsReinforcement.re4: Failed to create a straight rebar with a given preferred rebar shape "{0}". Error: {1}\nAn attempt was made to create a bar with automatic rebar shape selection or creation
mprSlabsReinforcement.re5: Failed to create a rebar of shape "{0}" with a given preferred shape of rebar "{1}". Error: {2}\nAn attempt was made to create a rebar with automatic rebar shape selection or creation
mprSlabsReinforcement.re18: Error while creating stirrups of the frame of the hole in the slab id={0}
mprSlabsReinforcement.re20: Failed to create rebar with a given preferred rebar shape "{0}". Error: {1}\nAn attempt was made to create a bar with automatic rebar shape selection or creation

mprColumnsReinforcement.Description: Analysis, grouping and reinforcement of columns for specified conditions
mprColumnsReinforcement.FullDescription: Plugin allows you to process both individually selected columns and all columns in a view or in a document. Reinforcement is carried out taking into account the relative position of the columns above each other. Transverse reinforcement can be assembled using a variety of rebar shape options. Plugin can work even on an empty template
mprColumnsReinforcement.h3: Select all columns on current view
mprColumnsReinforcement.h5: Reinforcement is possible only in structural columns
mprColumnsReinforcement.h28: Cover for the working reinforcement shall be not less than 20 mm or not less than the diameter of the reinforcement
mprColumnsReinforcement.h29: The diameter of the longitudinal working rebars of precast columns it is recommended to appoint not less than 16 mm. For monolithic columns and for structural reinforcement may be applied bar diameter 12 mm
mprColumnsReinforcement.h31: The number of rods in width:
mprColumnsReinforcement.h32: The number of rods in depth:
mprColumnsReinforcement.h34: The cross-sectional area of ​​the column, sq.mm:
mprColumnsReinforcement.h37: The cross-sectional area of ​​longitudinal reinforcement is not recommended to assign more than 5% of the cross-sectional area of ​​the column
mprColumnsReinforcement.h38: Spaces between the edges of the rods along the width of the column:
mprColumnsReinforcement.h39: Spaces between the edges of the rods along the depth of the column:
mprColumnsReinforcement.h40: Attention! When changing the diameter, cover or number of rods, the distances between the rods will be reset to equivalent values!
mprColumnsReinforcement.h47: Joints of longitudinal reinforcement of lower and middle columns with the same (or slight difference) cross-section of the overlying columns
mprColumnsReinforcement.h48: Joints of longitudinal reinforcement of lower and middle columns with a large cross section (≥ 100 mm on each side) to the overlying column with a smaller cross section
mprColumnsReinforcement.h49: Joints of longitudinal reinforcement of the top columns
mprColumnsReinforcement.h59: Specify type of shapes hooks, parameters, diameter and rebar bar type of rebar that will be set by default for added transverse reinforcement shapes
mprColumnsReinforcement.h60: Step of transverse reinforcement in areas of thickening, mm:
mprColumnsReinforcement.h65: Type of the surface of reinforcement:
mprColumnsReinforcement.h71: The main step of the transverse reinforcement is recommended to be taken equal to 15d, and the step of the transverse reinforcement in the areas of thickening is 10d. Where d is the diameter of the longitudinal (working) reinforcement
mprColumnsReinforcement.h72: Failed to add form to current layout: no place available to place the form!
mprColumnsReinforcement.h74: Replace with reinforcement settings of the group
mprColumnsReinforcement.h84: Cover from the rebars ends, mm:
mprColumnsReinforcement.h85: The main step of the transverse reinforcement, mm:
mprColumnsReinforcement.h86: Indent from the top of the column, mm:
mprColumnsReinforcement.h87: Thickening of transverse reinforcement in the upper zone of the column
mprColumnsReinforcement.h90: Thickening of longitudinal reinforcement in the lower zone of the column
mprColumnsReinforcement.h91: If there are incoming joints, set the thickening distance of the lower zone along the length of joints
mprColumnsReinforcement.h95: Hooks cannot be used in this form in a sketch
mprColumnsReinforcement.h98: Distance between the centers of the rods
mprColumnsReinforcement.h99: Distance between the edges of the rods
mprColumnsReinforcement.h100: Attention! The number and position of the longitudinal rebars and the layout of the transverse rebars can be saved, loaded and copied into the checked columns of a suitable cross section, but cannot be saved as default!
mprColumnsReinforcement.h104: Overlap length of straight joint, mm:
mprColumnsReinforcement.h108: Overlap length in the overlying column, mm
mprColumnsReinforcement.h109: The calculated overlap length is multiplied by 2
mprColumnsReinforcement.h141: Do not close the window after creating reinforcement
mprColumnsReinforcement.h144: Detail offset from base plate sole:
mprColumnsReinforcement.h149: Create joints only from floor in the category "Structural foundation"
mprColumnsReinforcement.h150: Joints from the underlying floor are created only if there is no underlying column. Column relations are defined only between selected columns
mprColumnsReinforcement.h165: If the floor above the column is missing, then
mprColumnsReinforcement.h166: Binding bends to the top of the floor (by the center of the rebar)
mprColumnsReinforcement.h167: Binding bends to the bottom of the floor (by the center of the rebar)
mprColumnsReinforcement.h174: L-shaped rebars (when creating bends of vertical rebars):
mprColumnsReinforcement.h177: C-shaped cross holes (stirrups). Hooks in sketch:
mprColumnsReinforcement.h178: S-shaped cross holes (stirrups). Hooks in sketch:
mprColumnsReinforcement.h185: Failed to set parameter values ​​for some elements. Below are the elements codes (id), parameter names, and set values:
mprColumnsReinforcement.h187: Reselect columns that were processed in the current view when using the plugin
mprColumnsReinforcement.h188: Indent from the bottom of the column, mm:
mprColumnsReinforcement.h190: Specify a rebar shape parameter that defines the radius of the spiral
mprColumnsReinforcement.h208: Use column geometry without considering connections
mprColumnsReinforcement.h227: Binding of the working rebar to the edge of the column by the center of the rebar. Binding is calculated by model diameter
mprColumnsReinforcement.h231: Couplers will be installed only if the treated columns have the same cross-section and the coupler type is present in the document. Coupler types are searched in the document based on the rules specified in the
mprColumnsReinforcement.h232: window. In columns where connectors will be installed, the longitudinal reinforcement will be made by individual reinforcing bars without a layout.
mprColumnsReinforcement.h233: Specify the rules for the installation of couplers for certain types of rebars. You can specify either the full name of the rebar type or a partial name. For example, specify the value "10". Then the type of rebar will be considered as suitable if it has "10" in its name.
mprColumnsReinforcement.h234: Bend the bottom of straight rebars
mprColumnsReinforcement.h237: Bottom bending is performed for straight rebars provided that the columns to be machined have the same cross-section.
mprColumnsReinforcement.h241: If there is already a form with the same sketch in the list, the properties will be taken from it
mprColumnsReinforcement.h244: It is not recommended to set the cover based on the reinforcement settings if the transverse reinforcement has different diameters and/or different values of the "Stirrup/Tie Attachment" property
mprColumnsReinforcement.err1: In the column reinforcement settings, there are bent "in the bottle" rods that must have a floor or non-zero distance between the columns in order to create them. No overlying floor found or distance to overlying column is 0
mprColumnsReinforcement.rr1: Remove reinforcement of the same type that is created
mprColumnsReinforcement.jt1: Longitudinal reinforcement joints are not created. The rods are cut off at the top of the column according to the specified value of the cover layer from the ends of the reinforcement
mprColumnsReinforcement.jt2: Straight joints of longitudinal reinforcement bars are created. The anchor length is set from the top of the overlying floor or from the top of the column if there is no floor. The position of the rods of the longitudinal reinforcement of the overlying columns is not taken into account
mprColumnsReinforcement.jt3: Joints of longitudinal reinforcement bars with a bend in the overlying column are created. The anchor length is set from the top of the overlying floor or from the top of the column if there is no floor.
mprColumnsReinforcement.jt4: Joints are created in the form of additional rods of the specified diameter
mprColumnsReinforcement.jt5: Straight joints of longitudinal reinforcement bars are created. The anchor length is set from the top of the overlying floor or from the top of the column if there is no floor
mprColumnsReinforcement.jt6: Joints of longitudinal reinforcement bars with anchoring in the overlying floor are created. The anchor length is calculated from the side face of the column
mprColumnsReinforcement.bbd1: All joints are bent along the short side of the column
mprColumnsReinforcement.bbd2: All joints are bent along the long side of the column
mprColumnsReinforcement.bbd3: The corner joints are bent towards the center of the column, while the other joints are bent along the column faces
mprColumnsReinforcement.bbd4: The corner joints are bent towards the center of the column. On the long side - along the edges of the column. On the short side - across the edges of the column
mprColumnsReinforcement.bbd5: The corner joints are bent along the long side of the column, while the rest are bent inwards into the column
mprColumnsReinforcement.bbd6: The corner joints are bent along the short side of the column, while the other releases are bent along the column faces
mprColumnsReinforcement.m20: The list of columns contains columns whose reinforcement settings have been changed manually and differ from the settings of the reinforcement group
mprColumnsReinforcement.m24: You did not specify for which groups to create reinforcement!
mprColumnsReinforcement.m25: No groups were selected for creating reinforcement!
mprColumnsReinforcement.m27: Attention! No loaded rebar shapes found in the current project! In this case, the rebar shapes created during the operation of the plugin cannot be opened in the Family Editor! It is recommended that before using the plugin, load the rebar shapes into the project!\nPerform reinforcement, despite the missing rebar shapes?
mprColumnsReinforcement.full2: Limited version only has one form available
mprColumnsReinforcement.noInFamily: Plugin operation in families is not available!
mprColumnsReinforcement.p9: Calculation and modeling of longitudinal reinforcement
mprColumnsReinforcement.p10: Calculation and modeling of transverse reinforcement
mprColumnsReinforcement.p14: Calculation and modeling of joints from the plate
mprColumnsReinforcement.e4: Failed to get main or union solid
mprColumnsReinforcement.e5: Failed to get the top or bottom face
mprColumnsReinforcement.e7: The name of the shape used to create the spiral reinforcement is not specified. Use the Preferred Rebar Shapes window to specify the shape of the spiral rebar
mprColumnsReinforcement.e9: The specified parameter that specifies the radius of the spiral reinforcement was not found in the document
mprColumnsReinforcement.t7: The group contains columns whose reinforcement settings have been manually edited and differ from the group reinforcement settings
mprColumnsReinforcement.t12: The column reinforcement settings have been edited manually and differ from the group reinforcement settings
mprColumnsReinforcement.t13: Edit the reinforcement settings of the selected column
mprColumnsReinforcement.t14: Replace column reinforcement settings from the group
mprColumnsReinforcement.t15: Display in the model the previous column in the list
mprColumnsReinforcement.t16: Display in the model the column selected in the list
mprColumnsReinforcement.t17: Display in the model the next column in the list
mprColumnsReinforcement.t40: Copy the reinforcement settings of the current group to all selected groups
mprColumnsReinforcement.t41: Save the reinforcement settings of current group in the xml-file
mprColumnsReinforcement.t42: Load the reinforcement settings from the xml-file and set it for the current group
mprColumnsReinforcement.t43: Attention! The surface appearance of the reinforcement may depend on the class of reinforcement, diameter or other values that are not considered by the program. Read the normative documentation
mprColumnsReinforcement.t44: α is a coefficient that takes into account the effect on the anchoring length of the stress state of concrete and reinforcement and the structural solution of the element in the anchoring zone. When anchoring rods of a periodic profile with straight ends (straight anchoring) or smooth reinforcement with hooks or loops without additional anchoring devices for stretched rods, take α = 1.0, and for compressed ones – α = 0.75. According to clause 10.3.30 of SP 63.13330, the coefficient α may be increased to 2.0
mprColumnsReinforcement.t53: Reset all values ​​of the current default reinforcement settings to the default values ​​set in the plugin
mprColumnsReinforcement.t63: You can specify preferred rebar shapes for different types of rebars created by the plugin.
mprColumnsReinforcement.t64: Setting the preferred shapes does not guarantee that the reinforcement will be created using the specified shape of the rebar.
mprColumnsReinforcement.t65: When creating rebars, an attempt will be made to use the specified shape. If creating a rebar with the specified shape is not possible, Revit will automatically search for a suitable shape or create a new shape.
mprColumnsReinforcement.t66: Save current reinforcement settings as default reinforcement settings
mprColumnsReinforcement.re1: An error occurred while creating longitudinal reinforcement for column id = {0}:
mprColumnsReinforcement.re2: An error occurred while calculating the location points of the transverse reinforcement for column id = {0}:
mprColumnsReinforcement.re3: An error occurred while creating a transverse reinforcement part of type "{0}" in column id = {1}:

mprColumnsReinforcement.re5: Failed to create a rebar of shape "{0}" with a given preferred shape of rebar "{1}". Error: {2}\nAn attempt was made to create a rebar with automatic rebar shape selection or creation

mprColumnsReinforcement.re18: Error creating couplers when connecting columns id={0} and id={1}:
mprColumnsReinforcement.re19: Error creating couplers when processing column id={0}:

mprBeamsReinforcement.Description: Analysis, grouping and reinforcement of beams for specified conditions
mprBeamsReinforcement.FullDescription: Plugin allows you to process both individually selected beams and all beams in a view or in a document. Transverse reinforcement can be assembled using a variety of rebar shape options. Plugin can work even on an empty template
mprBeamsReinforcement.h3: Select all beams on current view
mprBeamsReinforcement.h5: Reinforcement is possible only in structural beams
mprBeamsReinforcement.h28: Cover for the working reinforcement shall be not less than 20 mm or not less than the diameter of the reinforcement
mprBeamsReinforcement.h31: The number of rods in width:
mprBeamsReinforcement.h32: The number of rods in height:
mprBeamsReinforcement.h34: The cross-sectional area of ​​the beam, sq.mm:
mprBeamsReinforcement.h37: The cross-sectional area of ​​longitudinal reinforcement is not recommended to assign more than 5% of the cross-sectional area of ​​the beam
mprBeamsReinforcement.h38: Spaces between rods along the width of the beam:
mprBeamsReinforcement.h39: Spaces between rods along the height of the beam:
mprBeamsReinforcement.h40: Attention! When changing the diameter, cover or number of rods, the distances between the rods will be reset to equivalent values!
mprBeamsReinforcement.h44: Bend upper rods in case of insufficient anchoring distance
mprBeamsReinforcement.h45: Binding of the working rebar to the edge of the beam by the center of the rebar. Binding is calculated by model diameter
mprBeamsReinforcement.h59: Specify type of shapes hooks, parameters, diameter and rebar bar type of rebar that will be set by default for added transverse reinforcement shapes
mprBeamsReinforcement.h60: Step of transverse reinforcement in areas of thickening, mm:

mprBeamsReinforcement.h74: Replace with reinforcement settings of the group

mprBeamsReinforcement.h85: The main step of the transverse reinforcement, mm:
mprBeamsReinforcement.h86: Indent from the end of the beam, mm:
mprBeamsReinforcement.h90: Thickening at the ends of the beam
mprBeamsReinforcement.h91: Thickening of reinforcement at the ends of the beam in the absence of underlying elements (cantilevered beam ends)
mprBeamsReinforcement.h94: Take into account underlying and end columns and walls
mprBeamsReinforcement.h98: Distance between the centers of the rods
mprBeamsReinforcement.h99: Distance between the edges of the rods
mprBeamsReinforcement.h100: Attention! The number and position of the longitudinal rebars and the layout of the transverse rebars can be saved, loaded and copied into the checked beams of a suitable cross section, but cannot be saved as default!
mprBeamsReinforcement.h104: Anchoring length of straight joints, mm:
mprBeamsReinforcement.h141: Do not close the window after creating reinforcement
mprBeamsReinforcement.h177: C-shaped cross holes (stirrups). Hooks in sketch:
mprBeamsReinforcement.h178: S-shaped cross holes (stirrups). Hooks in sketch:
mprBeamsReinforcement.h187: Reselect beams that were processed in the current view when using the plugin
mprBeamsReinforcement.h207: Use beam geometry without considering connections
mprBeamsReinforcement.h208: Enter the longitudinal rebars in the adjacent perpendicular beams, located at the ends of the current beam
mprBeamsReinforcement.h241: If there is already a form with the same sketch in the list, the properties will be taken from it
mprBeamsReinforcement.h258: Do not create transverse reinforcement over underlying walls and columns
mprBeamsReinforcement.h259: Different rebar diameter for the top row:
mprBeamsReinforcement.h260: The width spacing of the bars is derived for the main diameter of the reinforcement. Other rebar diameters for the top row are not taken into account
mprBeamsReinforcement.h261: Indent from the beginning of the section, mm:
mprBeamsReinforcement.jt1: Longitudinal reinforcement joints are not created. The rods are cut off at the side of the beam according to the specified value of the cover layer from the ends of the reinforcement
mprBeamsReinforcement.jt2: Straight joints of the rebars of the longitudinal reinforcement are created. The anchoring length is set from the edge of the beam. The joints are only created if there is a wall or column at the end of the beam, otherwise the joints will not be created and the longitudinal bars will be cut at the end of the beam, taking into account the specified ends cover

mprRebarTools.Description: A collection of small auxiliary plugins for working with rebar
mprRebarTools.Description1: Remove all reinforcement from the selected host element
mprRebarTools.Description2: Copy rebars from the original host element into multiple target host elements
mprRebarTools.Description3: Turn the selected rebar set into individual rebar bars
mprRebarTools.Description4: Split a rebar set into two new rebar sets
mprRebarTools.h2: The selected element has a solid that does not match the source element in volume. The copied rebars will not be positioned correctly! Choose a further action:
mprRebarTools.h3: Apply the selected action to further cases
mprRebarTools.h9: Show all Rebars in Rebar Set
mprRebarTools.h10: Show First and Last Rebar in Rebar Set
mprRebarTools.h11: Show Middle Rebar in Rebar Set
mprRebarTools.h13: On the current view it is not possible to change the representation of the rebar
mprRebarTools.h14: It is not possible to change the representation for rebar with the "One" layout
mprRebarTools.h15: Show First, Last and Middle Rebar in Rebar Set
mprRebarTools.pv4: All but selected elements on view
mprRebarTools.msg1: Select an element with rebar or reinforcement
mprRebarTools.msg2: Select an elements with rebar or reinforcement

mprSplitRebar.Description: Splitting of straight rebars by length with different connection options
mprSplitRebar.smd1: Cutting a rebar into parts of the specified length with one of the parts of shorter length, in case the original rebar is not divided by the specified length without a remainder
mprSplitRebar.smd2: Cutting a rebar into parts of equal length, not exceeding the specified maximum length
mprSplitRebar.smd3: Cutting a rebar into an equal number of parts
mprSplitRebar.m1: The center line of a rebar is not a line segment
mprSplitRebar.m2: Failed to split the rebar according to the specified conditions
mprSplitRebar.m3: The rebar does not meet the conditions of splitting
mprSplitRebar.m5: An unexpected error occurred during processing of the rebar
mprSplitRebar.m6: It is not possible to create a curved rebar with the current parameters

mprPlateWeight.Description: Calculation of plate weight with recording the result in the specified parameter
mprPlateWeight.h7: Write total weight to the Connection parameter
mprPlateWeight.h8: If a Structural Connection is selected and a parameter is specified, the total weight of the plates included in the Connection will be written to the specified parameter
mprPlateWeight.msg1: The detail level of the current view will be temporarily changed to "Fine" to calculate the weight of the plates, which can lead to long regeneration of the graphics!
mprPlateWeight.err1: No physical properties in the Material
mprPlateWeight.err5: Failed to get Plate from Connection
